author: potuz
content: <@552133098075193354> we got some people asking in our discord if they should upgrade geth for the fork, given that they upgraded already prysm. I realized that the EF blog post does not mention MEV boost at all. Not sure if it's the place, but anyway I think we should stress that validators need to upgrade the three softwares they run, we got into this, we may as well be consequent

author: bridge-bot
content: <timbeiko> The blog post _does_ mention that you must upgrade your EL + CL (and both the BN + VC) for the CL â€” anything else missing?

author: bridge-bot
content: <timbeiko> Ah, sorry, I misread and interpreted "three softwares" as including the VC, not mev-boost. Generally don't think we should be advertising it as part of the blog post (or any "extensions" to node software).

author: potuz
content: That's fine in principle, but most of our blocks as a matter of fact are produced this way, we integrate MeV boost testing in our infra, we have these updates in ACD and we haven't tested our clients with an incompatible MEV boost thoroughly

author: potuz
content: So I think the right attitude is we got into this by mistake, but now we have to deal with it

author: potuz
content: If some of our users don't know they need to update the EL, many more won't know they need to update MEV boost

author: shitfuck27
content: why do the client releases in the blog post link to the first version with mainnet Dencun enabled? All but Nimbus and Nethermind have had further version updates

author: timbeiko
content:
<@590926428451766299> <@755590043632140352> you should both be happy with this morning's update to the blog post: 

https://blog.ethereum.org/2024/02/27/dencun-mainnet-announcement
